The internal surfaces of the cold water storage tank contained visible evidence of debris/sediment as well as staining above the
water line.
HSG274 Part 2 – Paragraph 2.57 - … The water surfaces should be clean and free from any visible, significant contamination.
The cold water storage tank should be cleaned, disinfected and any faults rectified. If debris and traces of vermin are found, the
inspection should be carried out more frequently.
Internally clean and disinfect the cold water storage tank. A tank inspection should be carried out after the clean and
disinfection, from the date of the disinfection an annual tank inspection should be carried out as part of the control regime
tasks.
